comments:
1) Launch Eclipse 2.0. I used Eclipse 2.0.1.
2) Open [Preferences].
3) Set [Java] > [Editor] > [Appearance] > [Text font] to any font other than
<Using Workbench Text Font>
4) Press [OK] to close the [Preferences], and exit Eclipse.
5) Launch Eclipse 3.1.1 with the same workspace.
6) The error "Error norifying a prefernce change listener. Check the log for
details" appears while launching. The log is as follows:

MvM, 3.1.2 candidate?  It seems that some legacy JDT code is breaking our assumptions about the preferences we're getting.
let's be sure we understand why this is happening first, then decide for 3.1.2
